transcript:
What should one love and what hate? What does one live for? And what am I? What is life, and what is death? What power governs all?" 
There was no answer to any of these ques- tions, except one, and that not a logical answer and not at all a reply to them. The answer was: "You'll die and all will end. You'll die and know all, or cease asking." But dying was also dreadful.
